lead_paragraph: John Rollins shot an eight-under-par 64 yesterday, edging Bob May by one stroke to win the B.C. Open for his second career victory on the PGA Tour. Rollins, who finished one shot behind Jason Bohn at last year’s B.C. Open, rolled in a 7-foot birdie putt on the final hole. The 31-year-old Rollins, in his sixth year on the Tour, surged past the third-round leader, Gabriel Hjertstedt, to finish at 19-under 269.
